Product Manager, AS YOU ARE Location: San Antonio TX or Syracuse NY Reports To: Chief Technology Officer COMPANY   As You Are is an exciting new company whose mission is to establish a world-class virtual clinic that dramatically increases access to early neurodevelopmental diagnostic services and care coordination. Roadmap Planning: Update and communicate the product roadmap, balancing long-term vision with short-term objectives. Metrics & Analysis: Monitor key product metrics to gauge product performance and make informed decisions. Participate in workshops, webinars, and conferences.    Problem Solving: Tackle unexpected challenges that arise during the product development cycle, making decisions to keep the projects on track. You will create high-leverage, business artifacts (Docs, PPTs, Excels, etc.) that are reusable; you will use these artifacts to facilitate and drive alignment with leaders throughout PG&E. You must be proactive in identifying and documenting existing business process operations, and inventive in developing what a future and aspirational state can be. No task is beneath you. You will develop, socialize, and maintain an integrated DA&I Product/Services roadmap that links customers’ demand(s) with Enterprise Data Management, Enterprise Platforms, and Operation needs. You will play a meaningful role in shaping how our data investments serve PG&E’s True North Strategy.  DA&I PMs embody PG&E Virtues, each day we show up and, in every engagement we are present. Assigned projects may be concurrent and may be complex with dependencies on other projects and/or departments. Under general supervision manage all aspects of project schedule, budget, quality, product cost targets and product development performance. This position reports to the Senior Manager of Program Management. Project Management - Lead the Product Development Process (PDP) for product development projects assigned by the Product Development Management Team. Perform tasks to define, plan, organize, and kick-off the project including assisting management team with the creation of the pre-profile document, integrating R&D activity into the project start, identifying project core and non-core team members, developing preliminary project schedule, and defining other project goals. Lead and manage cross-functional teams to deliver projects within the constraints of schedule, budget and resources. Elicit strong cooperation and assistance from designated departmental project leaders to ensure project success. Manage the concept, development, and detail phases by obtaining team member input to refine project goals and create detailed project schedule, project budget, cost targets, product performance targets, and quality goals. Manage the validation and implementation/production of the project through refinement, check, test, pre-production, and closure phases. Manage and monitor project progress to goals, resolve issues as appropriate, adjust plans where needed, and ensure a coordinated introduction of a quality product to production and customer. Perform post-project audit and report. Determine inventory balance on items during DV/MCS builds and disposition inventory based on feedback from Engineering whether to rework stock, scrap stock or use stock. Support project parts tracking. Leadership and Communication - Organize and facilitate key project meetings. Maintain accurate and organized project records and meeting minutes. Communicate in writing and orally project progress and deviation from goals as appropriate to project team members, key stakeholders, and executives. Organizational Development - Work to build the capability of project team members by providing coaching and mentoring where capable. Collaborate on tasks with Program Coordinator as appropriate. Locations: VA - McLean, United States of America, McLean, Virginia  Senior Manager, Product Management - Behavioral Data Group  Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology. We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry. Do you dream of more elegant and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? You have to ask yourself...do you feel like making an impact? In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas: Human Centered You’ll lead sourcing and synthesis of customer discovery efforts to understand customer needs to drive the long term vision for your product You’ll turn these customer insights into actionable strategies that will define the priorities for your team and rally your stakeholders to your vision Business Focused You’ll own and prioritize the long-term (12-18 months) product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, working closely with a cross-functional team to ensure that all the right resources are aligned to ensure that and your team will be successful You’ll define KPIs for your product and will be responsible for measuring and tracking to those measures, with an eye to adjusting and refining your roadmap as the data dictates Technology Driven You’ll have an end-to-end understanding of your product and how it fits into the larger ecosystem to be able to anticipate impacts from changes in other parts of the business You’ll work closely with tech leadership and architecture to understand the tradeoffs of technical decisions and how they impact the ultimately customer experience your team will deliver always looking to ensure you’re using the best tool for the job Transformational Leadership You’ll rally your teams and senior stakeholders to your product vision and proactively leverage relationships throughout the ecosystem to align to your vision and influence prioritization across partner teams You’ll be responsible for attracting and retaining top talent to your team and mentoring and developing associates on their product career The Behavioral Data Group is the fountain of the data lifecycle here at Capital One producing over 3 billion data records per day and managing the user behavior data collection (think clickstream), enrichment of this data, and delivery to downstream destinations for all applications at Capital One as well as the governance for the sharing of this data with external third parties. We support users throughout the business performing tasks in Marketing, Risk Management, Fraud, Identity Resolution, Personalization, and Product Analytics and Optimization. In your role, you will be responsible for: Continued success of the clickstream data as well as the future of the data pipeline and infrastructure. This entails working with the varied end-users within Capital One to understand their needs of this data and how value is delivered in the appropriate timeframes, alongside partnering with your tech counterparts to ensure the design and development of these features in a timely manner. Drive our data governance and sharing work stream with a focus on how we safely integrate, use, and share necessary information with partners while ensuring that our customers' data are protected. This includes oversight of our governance process, onboarding, data scrubbing, and data share management as well as a strategic view of how Capital One automates this governance and reporting. We want you if you are: Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges. Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you. Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work. Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs. Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help. Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.
